[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@thi.ng/rstream](./rstream.md) &gt; [bisect](./rstream.bisect.md)

## bisect variable

Returns a [PubSub](./rstream.pubsub.md) using given predicate `pred` as boolean [topic function](./rstream.pubsubopts.topic.md) and `truthy` &amp; `falsey` as subscribers for their respective values.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
bisect: <T>(pred: import("@thi.ng/api").Fn<T, boolean>, truthy?: ISubscriber<T> | undefined, falsy?: ISubscriber<T> | undefined) => PubSub<T, T>
```

## Remarks

If `a` or `b` need to be subscribed to directly, then `a` / `b` MUST be first created as `Subscription` (if not already) and a reference kept prior to calling `bisect()`<!-- -->.

## Example 1


```ts
fromIterable([1, 2, 3, 4]).subscribe(
  bisect(
    (x) => !!(x & 1),
    trace("odd"),
    trace("even")
  )
);
// odd 1
// even 2
// odd 3
// even 4
// odd done
// even done

```

## Example 2


```ts
const odd = subscription();
const even = subscription();
odd.subscribe(trace("odd"));
odd.subscribe(trace("odd x10"), map((x) => x * 10));
even.subscribe(trace("even"));

fromIterable([1, 2, 3, 4]).subscribe(
    bisect((x) => !!(x & 1), odd, even)
);

```
